name: Hotel Silken Ramblas Barcelona

reviews.text: Me and my family (all adults) just came back from a 3 nights stay at Hotel Ambassador in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Very nice days in the Ramblas!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is wonderfully located in the very heart of Barcelona, just on a little street by the Ramblas!! The street is "Pintor Furtuny" and it just between the 1898 hotel and the Meridien, so you understand how exclusive the area is.
reviews.title: Excellent Value for money

likes.liked: — The massive queen size bed and comfort of it
likes.disliked: — Could hear people above goin to toilet and tv remote stopped working(could'nt be bothered asking for batteries

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff is very nice and discrete: they don't disturb you but they're very nice when you need help.
reviews.title: Great Location/Great Service

reviews.text: The hotel lobby is a bit "cold" and dark, but not so bad. They should light it up a bit more.
reviews.title: Stay away from this hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was very very very rich! And you can even wake up late, because you can eat from 08.00 to 12.00.
reviews.title: 4* Location,but that's all.
Fantastic Location
reviews.text: Booked through lastminute and were upgraded upon arrival to a suite. Was fantastic room, very clean and spacious with a roof terrace and jacuzzi bathroom. Bar was good but location was FANTASTIC. Quiet but with Ramblas on the door step. Bar Lobo next door was lively and fun and Ramblas offered all sorts of fun ! Would recommend to anyone .... great value for money

I stayed at this hotel while on a business trip. True, the location is very convenient to the central shopping district and the staff are mostly courteous. But, they seem to have only one person on reception and one on bell duty at any given time, including prime check-in/check-out times. it is a very noisy hotel -- do NOT get a room in the upper 20s. Not only will you hear every flush your neighbor makes but also a tremendous amount of street noise.
reviews.title: Hardly 4-star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have no idea how this hotel secured a 4-star rating. Some of the lack of amenities in the $450/night junior suite in which I stayed:
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
Last Mintue Booking
reviews.text: No ironing board

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No pants hangers
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked a week at the Hotel Silken Ramblas through Easyjet (previously the Ambassador Hotel), stating on the booking we requred a room with disabled facilities. We had taken a significant time finding a hotel that was accessible for disabled travellers, and this hotel lived up to all expectations. It is situated in Calle Pinctor Fortuny, literally a two minute walk to La Ramblas, but quiet enough to be away from the constant activity on La Ramblas. The staff at Silken Ramblas were very helpful and polite throughout our weeks' stay. They booked taxis for us, assisted me in pushing my husbands wheelchair up and down the (rather slippery) slope within the hotel. The room was lovely and spacious - a very roomy bathroom with grabrails - the only problem was, that the flooring is extremely slippery when wet as it appeared to be made of marble. Other than that, everything was lovely. Crisp, clean sheets every day and nice, thick towels. There is a hefty room safe available for belongings.
reviews.title: Accessible Silken Ramblas

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend Hotel Silken Ramblas to travellers visiting Barcelona, due to the high quality of the hotel (4*), helpful staff, and great location. As we were travelling on a budget (of sorts!!), we did not use the hotel restaurant as it appeared very pricey.
reviews.title: Birthday Treat was well worth it!

likes.liked: — Location, friendly staff, cleanliness of hotel
likes.disliked: — A few more sunbeds by the pool would not go amiss!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent service from day one. Staff very friendly, always willing to help with anything.
reviews.title: Poor Quality Service, Not 4 Star for sure...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms when cleaned to a high standard, clean linen on the bed everyday, and clean towels.
reviews.title: So Convenient!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was to a high standard, good selection every morning.
reviews.title: great hotel

likes.liked: — staff, cleanliness, willingness to help, location - just off ramblas, very quiet but 1 mins stroll to la ramblas. perfect!
likes.disliked: — in basic room - two single beds pushed together, also bad selection of tv stations but you don't go there to watch tv so that shouldn't be a prob

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ambassador Hotel, Barcelona from 27th – 31st July 06. After reading previous comments about the hotel I was a little worried re the noise between rooms. Due to this I asked for a quiet room. I have to say our room and stay was a quiet one. We had a view onto a quiet street below – thankfully not near the traffic. The hotel is in an excellent position, just minutes from Las Ramblas and Catalonia Square (bus from the airport stops here). The hotel staff were very pleasant and kind – they even pointed out that the area had pickpockets – they advised us to be careful with our bags especially along Las Ramblas . Breakfast buffet ok – variety to choose from. Pool on the rooftop very small – very welcome though as the weather was very hot. No gym available – this is still closed – not sure why? The gym looks very small. The rooms are ok but really need updating with more modern decoration. The rooms are cleaned daily. I wouldn’t say the hotel was 4 stars, more 3 stars. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and in Barcelona – plenty to see and do.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

likes.disliked: — Could have been updated the decoration

reviews.text: We ended up here after another hotel lost our reservations. The city hotels were filled for a sporting event and we were walking down La Rambla going from hotel to hotel. We saw some hotels down a side street and ended up at the Ambassador. They had one room left--a two-room suite that they gave us for what I thought was a song. It was a corner room overlooking a picturesque side street and though a busy street, the soundproofing was excellent.
reviews.title: Great deal

reviews.text: The rooms were spacious and very comfortable. We had a king-size bed while our daughter had a twin in the next room. There was also free wireless internet service. The buffet breakfast was included in the price and was adequate. We had no other meals there as there are many restuarants two blocks away on La Rambla.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel also had English language newspapers. When checking in the clerk said that the hotel garage cost $20/day. That was in line with what I've paid in big U.S. cities, so it wasn't any shock. The nearby public garage would have been a little more for a 24-hour period. When I checked out, I didn't see a parking charge on the bill. I mentioned it and they said forget it, they weren't going to charge anything.
reviews.title: Good Hotel In Central Location
Perfect location
reviews.text: We never tried the rooftop pool, but the views of the city were interesting. I'd stay here again if I could get the same rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had high expectations of this hotel based on the reviews of other Silken hotels, recommendations of the chain by other travel Web sites and the description of the Silken chain philosophy. Initial impressions are good; on a quiet side street just off La Rambla and about 100 meters from Placa Catlalunya and with a contemporary though not cold reception area. Just down from Reception is a small lounge area containing a small but seemingly fully stocked bar and at the end of the lounge an impressive water feature. Check-in was painless, however the room we had been allocated was a twin room even though I had booked a room with a King bed. A quick call to Reception resulted in a change of rooms, but we had to wait an hour for it to be cleaned (we had arrived early so we had already waited an hour for the first room, not the Hotel’s fault and we didn’t mind). Returning after lunch there was no luggage in the room, another call to Reception and they insisted it had to be there; no it isn’t. Finally a receptionist came up and asked if we would help them look in the luggage area; they were still on the baggage cart from the first room effort.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

reviews.text: We were in Barcelona for a sailing regatta and our boat was full of people when me and my family decided to sleep away. We asked to the travel agent of the Barcelona Yacht Club and they found this nice hotel just near the Ramblas. Unfortunately the Ramblas is very crowded and during the night around the hotel there are a lot of drunks. When You enter the hotel You feel the change. Inside it is another world, all clean and confortable, there is even a small swimming pool and a sauna on the roof. Clerks are kind and rooms are clean, big enough and confortable. Beds are well done in the morning but when we asked to have clean laundry for the bathroom they forgot to bring it to the room. Price is very low because for 2 adults and 2 children we paid only 200,00 euros for one night. I suggest the hotel for families with children. Overall it was a good experience.
reviews.title: Nice hotel good fares bad location wonderful Barcelona

reviews.text: The hotel is right in downtown Barcelona, a short walk (5 min)from two subway stations and walking distance to all old town attractions. Quiet, clean, rooms larger than "usual" european. Free internet with good speed and stable connection. In room safe is large enough for a laptop + SLR camera+small camcorder. The staff was very pleasant and accomodating. If the hotel is in your price range, book it and you are not likely to be disappointed.
reviews.title: Nice place in downtown Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is good to explore Gothic part of the city, opera, Ramblas and the market. Plenty of restaurants, especially North/East of the Ramblas. The restaurants right on the Ramblas may be overpriced (>$100 for a regular dinner for two), going a bit away into the Gothic part is a bit cheaper and more "character". We found shopping in Barcelona not exciting (we are from Toronto), but I guess it depends where you are from.
reviews.title: Loved the Silken Ramblas

likes.liked: — Location, the lobby, the bedroom, bathroom...everything!

reviews.text: Subway system is complex but runs well. The passes are sold for different length of use, which is convenient. There is a system of bus tourist routes "Bus Turistica" which is convenient way to explore the attarctions. The main attractions are the Gaudi's architectural sites. Additionally we went to Parc Manjuic, take subway and walk up the hill. The lift is very expensive and not worth 20min walk.
reviews.title: Really liked it, will use it again both for business and tourist trips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is more for walking than for swimming. Neither sand or water are of carribean quality. End of May was not warm enough for swimming, in water we saw only windsurfers in wet suits. So, if you plan a beach vacation, not in May, and will be better off in the Carribean (if you are from the Americas).
reviews.title: ideally located

reviews.text: Looking for hotel to stay in Barcelona, we stopped outside Hotel Silken thinking it would be very pricey, but went in anyway. Was 100 euro for the night which seemed quite reasonable as the Hotel next door was 123 euro for night. It was an oasis in a very hot City. Efficient and great attention at desk, modern and refreshing. Rooms were beautifully appointed, great decor. Probably one of the nicest Hotels we had stayed in for a while. Loved the airconditioning. It is close to the main street in Barcelona and we walked everywhere from there. There is also a supermarket close by, bakeries and restaurants. A great spot. It was good walking around in the heat knowing you were going back to this cool and great room.
reviews.title: Loved the place

likes.disliked: — Internet a big expensive to use in lobby and restaurant expensive

reviews.text: This was my first visit to Barcelona, and I stayed here for six nights. When we arrived, we were told our room had been upgraded to a Silken Room. We were told this meant it had a double bed rather than two single beds pushed together. When we booked through the hotel website, I had requested a nice room because it was a birthday trip to the city - maybe this was the reason for the upgraded room, and was a positive start to my impressions of the hotel.
reviews.title: Above average hotel with nice pool.

likes.liked: — The roof terrace/pool and hotel location.

reviews.title: Clean,Convenient,Chose it for the Pool
reviews.text: The room we were given was on the first floor. It had a small balcony,just enough to stand on, overlooking the side street that the hotel is on. The room appeared clean and tidy and had a sofa bed as well as the double bed. The bathroom had limited lighting and the shower was even darker! The shower was over the bath, but a nice walk-in shower could easily be installed if the bidet's were removed. While getting ready to go out on our first night, we discovered the hairdryer didn't work. With wet hair, my friend made a quick call to reception and they informed us we would have to wait 1/2 hour until someone could come and have a look. We said we could not wait that long and wanted a replacement more quickly. Five minutes later, we had a new hairdryer. The bed was a double, but there are two separate duvet covers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool on the hotel roof was just what was needed after lots of walking around the city. However, there are only nine sunbeds and hotel has over a hundred rooms!!! I found myself choosing between lying on the floor, or on the wooden decking that covered what was once a jacuzzi pool. The hotel will supply a towel for the pool for a deposit of 10 euro each.
reviews.title: Honeymooning in The Silken Ramblas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over the course of our stay, we noticed that the large mirror in the room had not been cleaned at all (we had swatted some insects on it!) and there was a layer of dust on the pannelled walls. Apart from that, it seemed to be reasonably clean.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Silken

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, when we read of other reviews mentioning the noise intrusion from other rooms, we were aprehensive but the rest of the hotel sounded like the kind of thing we were looking for, so we risked it. I'm glad we did as there was no problem for us, with any noise whatsoever. I'm not saying it isn't possible in other rooms, but one can only speak as one finds, and we had no issues with noise.
reviews.title: Not at all bad!

likes.liked: — It was everything we wanted, with no problems.

reviews.text: The staff were pretty friendly, but my wife and I are the kind of people who like to be friendly, and use some words in the local language and that usually improves relations with all but the most obnoxious locals! The staff were helpful as before leaving home we emailed a couple of times, and rang, just to confirm bookings etc. After arrival, we were pleased with our room, which had a view onto a
reviews.title: good hotel; Great location

reviews.text: pleasant side street, and staff were helpful in pointing out local tourist sites, booking local shows, and warning about the local crime hotspots and techniques. We personally experienced nothing bad, but were on our guard most of the time.
reviews.title: very noisy hotel

reviews.text: The hotel bar is nice, we always had helpful staff there, on the few occaisions when we just felt like a cocktail. There are some terrific
reviews.title: Waterfall in Lobby!

reviews.text: small bars and cafes within easy walking distance, without ever going
reviews.title: Great facilities, spacious rooms and excellent location!!

description: This city hotel was built in 1992 and comprises a total of 105 rooms, including 8 Junior suites. The hotel bar is an ideal place to make a date, relax after the stress of a working day, or stock up on energy after a day exploring the city. Further amenities available to guests at this air-conditioned establishment include a lobby area with a 24-hour reception, a hotel safe, a currency exchange facility, a cloakroom, lift access, a cafe, a bar, a restaurant and conference facilities. Guests may also take advantage of the Internet access/WLAN, room service and a garage.
